listOfBooks.title: The Pragmatic Programmer
listOfBooks.author: Andrew Hunt & David Thomas
listOfBooks.description: A classic guide to programming best practices, focusing on pragmatic approaches to writing clean, maintainable, and adaptable code.

listOfBooks.title: Clean Code
listOfBooks.author: Robert C. Martin
listOfBooks.description: A handbook of agile software craftsmanship that teaches how to write code that is readable, reusable, and efficient.

listOfBooks.title: You Donâ€™t Know JS
listOfBooks.author: Kyle Simpson
listOfBooks.description: An in-depth exploration of JavaScript, covering core concepts, scope, closures, and asynchronous patterns for advanced developers.

listOfBooks.title: Refactoring
listOfBooks.author: Martin Fowler
listOfBooks.description: A comprehensive guide to improving the design of existing code, making it easier to understand, maintain, and extend.

listOfBooks.title: Design Patterns
listOfBooks.author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides
listOfBooks.description: The classic book on object-oriented design patterns that provides reusable solutions to common software engineering problems.

listOfBooks.title: JavaScript: The Good Parts
listOfBooks.author: Douglas Crockford
listOfBooks.description: A deep dive into the core features of JavaScript that make it a powerful and elegant language for web development.

listOfBooks.title: Introduction to Algorithms
listOfBooks.author: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, Clifford Stein
listOfBooks.description: A comprehensive and authoritative textbook on algorithms, widely used in universities and loved by software engineers worldwide.

listOfBooks.title: Effective Java
listOfBooks.author: Joshua Bloch
listOfBooks.description: A guide to best practices in Java programming, offering practical advice to write reliable, maintainable, and efficient code.
